author: draganrakita
content: What does EIP-7702 do with storage that got changed in authorized account? Is assumption to drop it?

author: parithosh
content: is this the spec test version we should target for the pectra-devnet-1?

author: daniellehrner
content: No, all the OP codes are supposed to work the same as with normal contracts. This includes `SSTORE` and `SELFDESTRUCT`: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-7702.md#lack-of-instruction-prohibition

author: parithosh
content: I'm not familliar enough with the exec-spec tests yet, but if eof is on top of pectra - wouldn't both tests be in the same release?

author: draganrakita
content: That is okay, but what about state clear?

author: draganrakita
content: Different suits/folders and there is no overlap. So these tests touch only EOF part even if other prague EIPs are enabled.

author: daniellehrner
content: AFAIK there is no state clear. If during the tx we write to the storage of the EOA account, we persist it. So EOAs can have non-empty storage after 7702

author: draganrakita
content: Oh, this is not the greatest solution

author: marioevz
content: That‚Äôs correct, at the moment they are on top of Cancun but might change when clients decide to do so and we have an EVM tool that can fill them üëç
